etymology.description: semantic 扌(扌) (shǒu, "hand") + phonetic 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") = push with the hand -> push
etymology.interpretation: The character 推(tuī) combines 扌(扌) (shǒu, "hand"), indicating the action done by hand, with 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird"), which provides the phonetic cue. This combination visually represents the concept of pushing something with one's hand.

examples.chinese: 他推门而入(他推門而入)。
examples.english: He pushed the door open and entered.

examples.chinese: 我推他一把(我推他一把)，他就赶快走开(他就趕快走開)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ tuī tā yī bǎ, tā jiù gǎnkuài zǒu kāi.
examples.english: I gave him a push, and he quickly moved away.

examples.chinese: 警察推开窗户查看(警察推開窗戶查看)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐngchá tuī kāi chuānghù chá kàn.
examples.english: The police pushed the window open to inspect.
